dialogues.text: Kent sits idly at his desk, evenly spacing a row of sharpened pencils across the desktop. Clearly there's no action here.  59.

dialogues.speaker: KENT, (V.O., CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Although we're simply inundated with calls, we limit ourselves to only the most demanding cases. It's a challenge, I won't deny it. The phone finally RINGS and Kent SEIZES it hungrily...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: A couple of slack-jawed yokels gape as Kent pulls a large deflated baloon down from a tree, "U.S. WEATHER SERVICE" stenciled on its side. Kent displays it to them, glaring. They grin sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: KENT, (V.O., CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I could tell you many strange stories, but unfortunately, all of them are classified.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME ANNIE'S KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Kent leans back in his chair, his story told.

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: I hope that helps to calm some of your worries, Annie. And you, too, Hogarth. Hogarth? The Agents all look around. Hogarth is nowhere to be seen KENT (CONT’D) You're supposed to be watching him! The Agents hustle out of the room. KENT (CONT’D) (then smiling, to Annie) For his own good, of course.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: Open the blast doors! The massive gates open: Hogarth, wearing a space helmet a carrying a plastic ray gun, walks through. WIDEN TO REVEA the gates are actually the giant's two hands.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Level two. Commander Thruster to base... I have found the escape vehicle.  60. The giant's hand takes him up, up... to a junk car atop a big junk pile. Hogarth climbs in, grabs the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Main engines: 1, 2, and 3! Blast off! The giant grabs the car and "flies" it around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean sits on his porch, watching.

dialogues.speaker: GIANT
dialogues.text: Hogarth's face compresses from the G-forces. He looks green.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: We're landing... we're landing! From his porch Dean watches, grins. The car "lands", Hogarth stumbles out, dizzy. The giant CHORTLES.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Only one creature could create such destruction. The hideous, man- eating killing machine... ROBOTRON! Hogarth waits. The Giant just stands there, staring at hi HOGARTH (CONT’D) (impatienly) Robotron...

dialogues.speaker: GIANT
dialogues.text: Roarrrr....

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: No, no, no. Bigger...!

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: Good! Okay, Robotron... take

dialogues.speaker: THIS
dialogues.text: He whips his toy gun out, aims it at the Giant and pulls trigger. It WHINES and sparks. Suddenly the Giant freezes. His eyes lock on the gun, and reddish glow comes into his eyes.  61.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When I zap you, you're supposed to fall down. Remember? Like I told you... With his eyes still glowing, the Giant reaches out both hands, zombie-like, towards Hogarth.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey... The hands begin closing around Hogarth, who is beginning panic.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait a minute! It's me, Hogarth... He sees that the Giant is staring at his gun, and quickly slips it behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your friend! The Giant freezes. The red fades from his eyes. Then he looks at his hands which are closed threateningly around Hogarth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cont'd) Hey, it's okay. I know you didn't mean it. But, uh, maybe that's enough playing for now. Hogarth gets up and heads for Dean's house. As he turns a from the Giant, we see that he wears a look of deep conce

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hogarth takes a seat on the porch beside Dean, who is scanning the hills with binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: You're sure you weren't followed?

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's not too hard to lose those guys.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Don't get cocky. Even guys in suits can learn.  62.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: Why do they want to get him, anyway? Just because he's different?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: That's generally all it takes.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: They don't even know him, and they just assume he's dangerous. They stare out at the Giant, as he opens a car hood, pluc out the engine, eats it, and throws away the "shell." The Giant

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. I just hope they're wrong.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: (suspicious) What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Look, I saw what happened out there just now. When you drew a gun on him, he got a look in his eye...

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: It's not his fault! He can't help it.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: That's what worries me. We don't know what he's capable of. On the surface he may be gentle, but on the inside he could be a killer. looks up curiously. Hogarth shushes Dean.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: (whispering) Don't use that word around him!

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: Because he cares. I can't explain it, but... he cares about what he is. He's getting so he can understand all kinds of stuff now. If he hears you use that word around him...  63.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. I'm just saying, be careful. (pause) So... have we got a plan here? I mean, he can't stay here forever.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: (sadly) I know...

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: The longer he stays, the better their chance of finding him. We've got to get him out of here, Hogarth.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: How? He's a little too big to smuggle out in a suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: We could do it in pieces.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: You mean take him apart?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: You think he'd go for that? I've got a junk-truck -- I'm always hauling scrap. In half a dozen trips, we could get him to Canada. There are places in the Yukon, old mining sites, no one around, plenty of metal. He could roam the earth and live off the land... sounds pretty good, actually. Hogarth thinks about it.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: The sooner the better. Tonight if possible.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: Tonight??? But I only just met him a couple days ago! (pleading) At least wait until tomorrow...  64. Dean looks at the Giant, lounging peacefully in the junkyard.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Alright, I guess one more day won't make a difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: R&B; BLARES: Little Richard. Hogarth draws pictures of th giant, they're good. He hides the pictures from view, carefully covering them with a book before EXITING the ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hogarth sharpens some pencils with the sharpener mounted the inside of the broom closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hogarth returns, goes to his desk, stops stunned: the gia drawings are uncovered. Eyes wide, Hogarth looks around h room: everything looks slightly askew, as if it's been... searched. Hogarth's neck-hair tingles. He stares at the his bedroom door, slowly pulls it toward him... REVEALING: KENT standing behind it... smiling.

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: Surprise.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: Kent. What are you doing in my room? He holds up a 45 RPM record, still in its sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: Just being friendly. And all that that implies. I know how you kids like rocky roll, so- He goes to the phonograph, and puts it on the platter...

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: Pat Boone...?

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: Yeah, baby. It's got that jungle rhythm, but you can understand the words...  65.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: Uh.... thanks. Kent starts to undulate awkwardly to the music...

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: Come on, Hogarth. Let's do the happy monkey. You know the one I mean... Hogarth edges toward the door, Kent follows, still dancing...

dialogues.speaker: KENT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Friends, Hogarth, that's what we ought to be. But friends don't keep secrets from each other.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about...

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: You don't. Well, let me tell you a little story. Your mom says you like 'em. Kent steps in front of the doorway, his smile now chillin KENT (CONT’D) Once there was a boy who walked into a forest. He wanted to take a picture of a metal-eating giant -- but lo and behold, the giant ate his camera alllll up!! Hogarth looks baffled.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: How did you -- ?

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: Because in the process, the Giant snapped a picture of himself. (holds up a roll of film) And the little boy brought the film home. Hogarth lunges for the roll of film.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: Give it back!  66. Kent dangles the film over Hogarth's head for a moment, t drops it into Hogarth's hands. Hogarth looks at it. HOGARTH (CONT’D) Empty... Kent slips a black-and-white photo from his coat, and han it to Hogarth. It shows the Giant's face, its mouth wide open.

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: The Army arrives in twenty-four hours, Hogarth. Just thought you'd like to know. Kent dances out of the room. Hogarth stares, helpless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kent puffs on his pipe, as Annie knits. Hogarth sits ina chair studying them. Kent breaks the silence.

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: Well, isn't this a fine way to spend an evening? We're like one big happy family... Hogarth looks up, staring darkly at Kent.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: You're not family. And when my Dad finds out you sat in his chair, he'll hunt you down like a dog--

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Hogarth! Kent turns to Annie. He makes a half-hearted gesture of getting out of his chair.

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: (starting to rise) I'm sorry, should I...?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: No, no, don't get up. My husband -- Hogarth's father -- he's... he was an Air Force Pilot in Korea. A casualty.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: He's coming back.  67. Ignoring Hogarth, Kent puts on a look of deep sympathy, a turns to Annie.

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: No you're not!

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Hogarth!

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: But, Mom, this guy doesn't care about anything -- cats like him race around, play the game, chase money, chase power...but he keeps buttering you up so you won't see that!

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Hogarth, that is enough! I think you owe our guest an apology.

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: (chuckling) Oh, now, there's no need for that. Hogarth is right in a way. I'm certainly ambitious. Yes... (looks pointedly at Annie) Ambitious, career-minded, stable --

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: He's doing it again! Kent gives Hogarth a patronizing smile.

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: Hogarth. I would have thought a good American boy like yourself would have more respect for the work I do. The world has become a dangerous place, you know. The balance of power is delicate. I gather information. And the side that has the information is the side that will win. Hogarth fixes his eyes on Kent with an intensity that's unnerving.  68.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: They say the soul is part angel and part monster. One look at you and I know the monster is gonna win.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: That's it. You either apologize or go right up to bed right now! Hogarth throws up his hands and marches out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Honestly, I don't know where he's getting these wild ideas. He's starting to talk like that beatnik...

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: Beatnik...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hogarth is in bed, the lights are out. Annie appears in h doorway, silhouetted by the light in the hall. She linger for a moment, thoughtful... She EXITS.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Have you been out at the junkyard, Hogarth?

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: (after a long pause) Which junkyard?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: The only junkyard. Dean's junkyard.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: (another pause) If I had ...would you be mad at me?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: No... (more quietly) +..no. (sad smile) Tell him "hi" for me. Hogarth stares at the ceiling... and sighs.  69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A convoy of Army vehicles is pouring into town. Kent watc them enter, euphoric. He glances at his watch, and remembering an appointment, rushes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Army General sits at a booth, studying a map. Kent sit across from his, positively glowing with pride.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL
dialogues.text: Hills, valleys, woods, ravines. Lot of places to hide, around here.

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: Yes, it's remarkable isn't it, sir? Kent looks around at the various coffee-shop Busybodies, speaks loudly, for their benefit.

dialogues.speaker: KENT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That one man, working alone, could have single-handedly found a monster in a place like this? The Busybodies coo and murmum amongst themselves.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL
dialogues.text: (still studying map) Hard to know where to start, really...

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: Well, sir, perhaps I can be of some help in that regard. You see, I've had my eye on an odd little boy who seems to be connected to the creature in question. And I have reason to believe he's been spending some time at a local scarpyard. From behind the counter, Annie looks sharply at Kent, finally understanding his attentions.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL
dialogues.text: Can you take me there?

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: But of course, sir. (loudly, for the busybodies) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: KENT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When a five-star general needs my help, I'm only too eager to oblige. Annie comes by and refills their coffee.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: I'm the mother of that "odd" little boy.

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) Oh yes, ahem.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: And if you're going up to the junkyard, I'm coming along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean is welding a sculpture of a hooded executioner. Inst of an axe, the executioner wields a flag -- part Hammer a Sickle, part Stars and Stripes. There's a knock at his door.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Come in. In walks the General and Kent followed by a few soldiers. Annie comes in last. Dean takes off his welding goggles, and studies all the uniforms. DEAN (CONT’D) I assume you're here for the Lenny Bruce albums.

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: Watch the wise cracks, Beatnik. We represent America.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: We all represent America, man.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL
dialogues.text: Sir, my name is General Shannon Rogard. We have reason to believe you are harboring a large... (finding this hard to swallow) +.. creature whose interest run counter to those of the United States. Do you deny it?  71.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Hey, man, if a cat needs to flop, my pad springs eternal. The General and the Soldiers exchange puzzled glances. On of them leans towards the General and speaks in hushed tones.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: As I understand it, sir, a "cat" is a member of the counter-culture.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL
dialogues.text: What rank?

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Well... As the General and the Soldiers continue to confer, Annie steps forward and speaks to Dean. Annie and cool.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Is Hogarth here? Is he alright? These people say he may be in some kind of trouble.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: He's not here, Annie. But he is alright. (then, gently) Believe me, I would never let anything happen to that little guy. Dean share a look. Kent sees this and loses his

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: Alright, I've had enough! He turns to the soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: KENT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You and you! Start rummaging around! Tip some tables over! Kick open doors! Break stuff! You know the drill! Kent claps his hands. The soldiers don't move.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: (to Kent) We all hear you yacking, daddy-o, but no one's listening.  72. Kent seethes.

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Not yet. Not yet. Annie looks from one to the other, comparing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Giant strolls through the forest, with Hogarth on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: I know this is hard for you to understand, but...well, it might be a real long time before we get to hang out like this again. The Giant is oblivious to anything but the beauty of the day. He turns his face up towards the sun as it ours thro the trees. Birds are singing. All is peaceful.

dialogues.speaker: GIANT
dialogues.text: (CONTENTED SOUND)

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: Yeah, it is beautiful, isn't it? Through a patch in the trees, they spot a deer.

dialogues.speaker: GIANT
dialogues.text: (CURIOUS SOUND)

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: It's a deer. "Deeeer."

dialogues.speaker: GIANT
dialogues.text: Deeeer... The Giant takes a step towards it. It darts away. Hogarth points.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: That way! Full of childlike curiosity, the Giant follows, and a gam of hide and seek begins. Hogarth laughs happily, as they dart in and out of the trees. At last he finds the deer grazing in a clearing. The Giant is FASCINATED. HOGARTH (CONT’D) (whisper) Shhhhh... let's get closer...  73. The Giant tries to sneak nearer, leaning on a pair of tal trees, which begin to teeter. He grabs one, and as he quietly pushes it back into place... the other crashes to the ground. The treetop lands near the deer, who bolts aw from it and directly toward the Giant--almost into the Giant's foot. The deer STOPS, puzzled by the strange metal obstacle. He looks up... right to the Giant's face. The Giant SMILES-- --which SPOOKS the deer, who darts off in the other direction. The Giant reaches out and catches it, in one huge hand, l a kid trapping a butterfly. HOGARTH (CONT’D) You caught it! The Giant laughs and opens his hand. The deer lies motionless. The Giant and Hogarth look stunned. The Giant tenderly lays the deer down on the ground, kneels, and nudges the deer with a big finger. Nothing. It doesn't move. HOGARTH (CONT’D) It's... dead.

dialogues.speaker: GIANT
dialogues.text: Deh...? There is a long silence. The Giant nudges the deer again.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: (suddenly vehement) Don't do that! It's dead. Okay?? That means it's not going to move! It's gone! And it's not coming back, understand?? (softly, tears flowing) It's not ever going to come back... It begins to snow, softly. From high above, through the trees, the boy and the giant stare down at the lifeless deer. They bow their heads in sorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snow falls harder now. The depressed giant sits ona hillside, snow piling up on his motionless bulk, staring into the forest. Dean and Hogarth watch him, worried.  74.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: This is bad. This is very bad. The Army's on it's way. We've got to get him out of here!

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: He doesn't know how to think about it.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: You've got talk to him. You've got to get through to him.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: Me? I don't know about this stuff...

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: You know as much as anyone does, kid. And he trusts you. Speak from your heart. It's the only chance we've got. Hogarth looks at the Giant.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: Alright. I'll try. He walks over to the Giant, climbs up his leg, and sits o his knee. The Giant turns and looks at Hogarth, with wear eyes. Hogarth sighs. HOGARTH (CONT’D) It wasn't your fault. No response from the Giant. HOGARTH (CONT’D) Things die. It's part of life. Hogarth reaches for the overhanging branch of a nearby tr and picks two leaves -- a brown on and a green one. He holds up the green leaf.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Life... He holds up the brown leaf.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .»..and death... He gestures at the forest around him.  75.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...they're part of the way things are. He points at the Giant and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You didn't make it that way. Do you understand? It's not your fault. The Giant gazes at Hogarth for a beat, then takes the lea from the boy's hands and studies them. Hogarth hops down stands by Dean.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: What's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: He's thinking. It's not an easy thing to understand. Dean looks at Hogarth with empathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kent is on the phone with the chief. He's visably PALE. (INTERCUT the following with the CHIEF in Washington, D.C

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: But Sir... you're making a big mistake! We're close... I have a real gut fee--

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: (CUTTING HIM OFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mansley, if I hear about your gut feelings one more time I'm going to vomit through the phone lines!! The press has got ahold of this thing and now I'm a laughing stock for spending tax dollars on your IDIOTIC plan! I'm pulling those troops out THIS MINUTE! Before MY career is as dead as YOURS!! The Chief SLAMS the receiver down so hard, it hurts Kent' hand in Maine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Giant still ponders. Just then, a pair of Army planes comes into view. We hear a beeping sound.  76.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: Oh no...

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: What is it? The panels on the Giant's arms slide open, and the strang tracking device pops out again.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: I was going to tell you... The Giant looks confused as another panel opens, and what appears to be a rocket launcher pokes out, tracking the planes. As they pass, the weapons recede and the panels close. The Giant looks distressed.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Good God, Hogarth he's armed                         How could you keep this from me?

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: Would you have let him stay?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: That's why.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Oh, man. Oh man, Hogarth! This is serious! What are we doing?? He's not some lost puppy...he's a weapon! ! Dean is pointing at the Giant now. Hogarth sees the Giant watching Dean with eyes wide.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: Dean, shh--

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: He's a machine, Hogarth! He was made, designed--to kill! The Giant stands up. He looks at himself, and then at Dea And then, with a terrible roar, he runs away. Dean and Hogarth share a look of panic. DEAN (CONT’D) This is bad.  77.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: We gotta find him!

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Come on! They run for his house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kent watches in despair as the ARMY pulls out of Rockwell taking his credibility, and hopes for the future, with th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Giant wanders through the falling snow, deeply distur and depressed, not knowing, or caring, where he's going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wheels a motorcycle out. Hogarth jumps in the sidecar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Giant blindly marches on, agitated, grieving.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Dean and Hogarth speed into the driving snow, following t Giant's quickly filling footprints.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: He's headed right toward town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FILLING THE SCREEN: a woman SCREAMS. LOUD. REVERSE: the Giant peers down at a tiny woman, her TINY SCREAM barely heard from his viewpoint. He waves meekly. BACK TO: the woman SCREAMS... runs in, SLAMS the door. The Giant wonders... He looks behind him, is something ba there...? Nope.... He shrugs. He wanders on, the streets largely deserted, the snow falls heavily.

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING IN A SECOND-STORY WINDOW
dialogues.text: A TODDLER watches a TV monster movie. Bored, he looks out the window... and sees a real monster. He blinks, isn't sure whether to be scared or not.  78. The Giant sees the kid staring at him. The Giant smiles, and waves. The kid grins, waves back. The kid HOLLERS, in silence. TWO OLDER KIDS join him at t window, look out, see a waving giant. They look stunned, and wave back. One YELLS a silent "MOM!". MOM appears at the window. The Giant waves. She turns white, SCREAMS silently, YANKS down the window shade. The Giant blinks, disturbed. BOW-WOW-WOW! He looks down: a tiny TERRIER BARKS ferociously at him, then NIPS at his foot... and YELPS in pain.

dialogues.speaker: GIANT
dialogues.text: Rock. The giant reaches down for the terrier: it YIPES and runs away. The giant looks disappointed. He looks up: nearby, several VILLAGERS stand in the falli snow, staring up at him. He waves. The villagers run inside, SLAM their doors. The giant MOANS, depressed.

dialogues.speaker: WITH DEAN AND HOGARTH
dialogues.text: In the snow, Dean drives flat-out. In the side-car, Hogar hangs on for dear life. They blow past-- KENT... going the other way. Kent SLAMS on his breaks, hi suspicions aroused, and hangs a U-TURN, almost colliding with the last of the TROOPS. Their truck screeches to a stop. Kent jumps out, waving his arms as he runs up to th driver.

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: STOP! I know this'll sound crazy, but--

dialogues.speaker: THE MIDDLE OF TOWN
dialogues.text: A scene out of a 50's horror movie: a dozen VILLAGERS run SCREAMING from a huge giant behind them.... But this giant just stands there, his shoulders droop, heartsick. He realizes that everyone is terrified of him. and he doesn't understand why. If the Iron Giant could cry, he would.  79. SIRENS sound in the distance, getting closer. The giant turns around and heads back out of town, toward the junkyard and home. SHREEEEEK! Right in front of him, A WOMAN SCREAMS, her hands fly up... releasing her baby carriage which rolls right up against the giant's feet. The giant looks down... sees an INFANT inside. The baby CcOOS and waves at the giant, who grins and waves back. A last, a friendly face! Two police cars SCREECH up, TWO COPS leap out and fumble their guns. The mother SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: It's got my baby! The cops stare, stunned, at the Giant towering over the baby. One cop RADIOS for help. Annie exits the diner, see the scene, joins the crowd, terrified, watching: The Giant seems to be... making faces at the baby. The fascinated giant CHORTLES and leans way down to look clos at the GIGGLING infant: which looks threatening to onlookers. The mother SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shoot it! Alarmed, the cops raise their guns. Dean and Hogarth SCREECH up on Dean's motorcycle....

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: No! The cops FIRE. The bullets bounce off the Giant's sides. The Giant turns: what was that? His eyes zero in on the cop's guns--and turn BRIGHT RED. With a heavy machinery

dialogues.speaker: WHIRR
dialogues.text: ... a FUTURISTIC WEAPON springs up out of the Giant's rig arm, which he instinctively swings toward the police car. Cops and soldiers leap aside as a GREEN RAY shoots and--

dialogues.speaker: KA-THOOOOOOM
dialogues.text: --the police car EXPLODES in an unearthly blast that send blue fireball roiling into the sky. The Giant's arm jerks round, catching the helpless cops and soldiers in its cro hairs...  80. ...but the Giant's eyes suddenly clear: alarmed, he knock his arm aside before it FIRES: KA-THOOOOOOM! The RAY rips through the air, destroying a grove of trees on the far s of town. The Giant RECOILS, horrified by his own destructive power He forces the gun back into his arm and rushes away, vanishing into the night. Dean and Hogarth exchange glances. They turn to go and--- --run straight into KENT and a group of SOLDIERS. They've seen the whole thing, and Kent has never looked more SMUG

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: (to soldiers) Seize them. The soldiers do as they're told, grabbing Dean and Hogart

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: Hey! Get your hands off! Let go of me! You're hurting me! Help!! As they pass through frame we see that KENT is holding a MICROPHONE, and recording Hogarth's protestations on a ta recorder. He SMILES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Giant hides, anxious and watchful. Then he hears a distant sound echoing through the trees, a voice...

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: Let go of me! You're hurting me! Help!! That's all the Giant needs to hear. He's off... moving swiftly through the dark forest in the sounds direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Giant moves to the edge of the forest, and pauses distrustfully. The town is oddly still. Hogarth's voice can still be heard calling for help. Then the Giant spies-- HOGARTH-- gagged and tied to the top of a radio tower on roof of the five story Cross building, the tallest in Rockwell. He squirms. The moment the Giant starts to move toward the building t Army (camouflaged) OPENS FIRE.  81. Suddenly the Giant is being hit from all sides (rifles, machine guns, bazookas): ARMOR (which we haven't seen before) slides out of his body and locks into a covering around him. A stray shot takes out of chunk of the base of the tower that Hogarth is tied to, and it starts to TOPPLE. The Giant SEES THIS and rushes directly into the line of fire to SHIELD Hogarth from being crushed by the tower. T Giant pulls the tower loose, sliding Hogarth into his met hand.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL
dialogues.text: He's got the boy!! HOLD YOUR FIRE!

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: It's KILLED the boy!! Don't let it get away!! A wall of artillery closes the entrance to town... and begins to fire away at Giant. The Giant looks toward the -but sees armed ships out there, their guns pointed towar land. Once again, various weapons begin to pop out of the Giant arms. He presses them back in. He turns, and RUNS straigh at the wall of Artillery. And JUMPS OVER IT. Everyone stares gape-jawed, then quickly tries to swivel their guns in the opposite direction. But the GIANT is already GONE. The general calls to the AIR FORCE.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL
dialogues.text: This is General Rogard! Code red! Repeat-- code red!

dialogues.speaker: COUNTRYSIDE
dialogues.text: The Giant, carrying Hogarth, hustles through the snow, slipping occassionally, but moving with surprising swiftness. Behind them, JET FIGHTERS appear on the far horizon. And in a moment they're on top of them... strafing the ground with machine gun fire, launching rockets, etc... The Giant bursts through the trees, and suddenly finds himself on a two-lane highway--about to step on cars and terrified people driving them!  82. The Giant SIDESTEPS to avoid them, losing his balance at full run and SLAMMING into the snowy ground --SLIDING thunderously for the better part of a mile, and cutting a very large swath through whatever happens to be in the wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie struggles with two Agents, who hustle her into a ca

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Let me go! I have to get to my son! What is going on?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: I'm afraid that's classified, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Classified? What do you mean? She tries the door. It won't open. She pounds on the wind

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Open this door! Hey! And then she notices that she's not alone in the car. Bes her is Dean, who sits with his head in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Giant tries to swat at the fighter planes as they fly overhead, but they are just out of his reach. He grabs a fallen tree, swinging it like a club, clipping off most o one fighters' WINGS. The pilot EJECTS just before the jet plows into the earth, bursting into a fireball. More and more fighters appear --too many-- BLASTING away the Giant. He veers toward a high cliff--and JUMPS---

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Imagine a five story building smashing into the sea and y might conjure the explosion of bubbles caused by the Giant... only moments before the fighters swoop the water surface, strafing it with machine gun fire. The bullets p up short, impotently. The Giant feels safe. Then he looks to his hand-- Hogarth is drowning. The Giant is stuck; he can't surface because of the jets, but he can't let Hogarth drown.  83. He reaches up with his other hand, cupping it above the waters surface, and pulls it down below, allowing Hogarth breathe in the pocket of air. Just then-- A SUB catch the Giant in their sights. They launch torpedoes. The Giant dodges them, but they explode into the base of the cliffs not far away--causing an avalanche of rock to splash into the ocean--which the Gia has to dodge while still holding Hogarth in his pocket of air. More ships appear and they launch DEPTH CHARGES, which explode around the fleeing giant, convincing him he'd bes take his chances above water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie stares out the window. Dean slumps in his seat.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: It's my fault. I should've done something... something different...

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: I know the feeling.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: I just thought the kid could use a friend.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: You were right, Dean. You were right.

dialogues.speaker: THE CLIFFS
dialogues.text: With great difficulty, the Iron Giant climbs the rocky, crumbling cliff face one-handed as the military keeps the heat on. Finally, unable to find purchase on the cliff face, the Giant stays on a small outcropping, turning to face the onslaught. Military helicopters descend into view, shining blindingl bright spotlights on the Giant, who is now showing a lot wear and tear. Weapons break out like hives all over the Giant's body; i clear that the Army is about to get the worst end of the deal.  84.

dialogues.speaker: THE GIANT'S FACE
dialogues.text: Something changes in the Giant; he WILLS the weapons to retreat back into his body, and--haltingly--they DO.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE CHOPPER
dialogues.text: The pilot trains his weapons on the Giant and shouts into his radio.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: We have him in our sights sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kent is rabid.

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: (to General) What're you waiting for?? FIRE!!

dialogues.speaker: THE CLIFF FACE
dialogues.text: The Giant turns-- but he's surrounded. It looks bad. Then... ... a low RUMBLING SOUND BEGINS... and BUILDS to a ROAR..

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: What's happening...?

dialogues.speaker: THE GIANT
dialogues.text: (PUZZLED SOUND)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both look down; the Giant's feet begin to flame like rockets as he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Giant and HOGARTH are FLYING... kind of. They BLAST along, out of control, the Giant's arms flailing.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: Steer that way!

dialogues.speaker: THE GIANT
dialogues.text: (MORE PUZZLED SOUNDS)

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: I don't know!! Point your arms, maybe-- like Superman! The Giant does as he's told... and they fly (more or less in that direction. The Giant grins.  85.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: OK! Now land! (Giant looks blank) Uh... drop your arms! The Giant lowers his arms to his sides... and the ROCKETS SPUTTER out. The two PLUMMET to the ground. KA-THUMP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOGARTH and the Giant, dazed from their "landing", collec their wits. And here come the spotter planes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hogarth and the Giant stand together, and watch the Army close in.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: It's no good. There's too many of them. We'll never get away. He sits down in despair. The Giant sits down too. HOGARTH (CONT’D) They're going to take you away, Giant. There's nothing we can do. For a long moment they sit in silence. Finally the Giant speaks.

dialogues.speaker: GIANT
dialogues.text: Rock.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: (looks up) Huh?

dialogues.speaker: GIANT
dialogues.text: Roooock. Treeee... Hogarth smiles.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: Yeah. Remember when I taught you that?

dialogues.speaker: GIANT
dialogues.text: Churrrrch. Skoooo saauuugz.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: (laughs) That was a great night, too.  86.

dialogues.speaker: GIANT
dialogues.text: (quietly) Faa-grrrr...

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: GIANT
dialogues.text: Deeer.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: (tearfully) I know. We've been through a lot together, haven't we? He puts his hand in the Giant's hand.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm going to miss you so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a long periscope lens, as the sub rounds the poin we see the cliff and the Giant come into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first mate looks up from the periscope--

dialogues.speaker: FIRST MATE
dialogues.text: I've got a visual on the monster, sir!

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Do we have a clear shot?

dialogues.speaker: FIRST MATE
dialogues.text: Not yet, sir.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Get closer! Don't surface until the last minute!

dialogues.speaker: SPOTTER
dialogues.text: Monster sighted off the port bow!

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: We'll only get one shot!! Full speed ahead!  87.

dialogues.speaker: THE BAY
dialogues.text: The sub begins to RISE to the surface, unaware that the cruiser is speeding toward the same position. The cruiser SWERVES to avoid collision, but it's too late the cruiser CLIPS the submarine aft, causing a fatal BREA that splits the sub.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE SUB
dialogues.text: CHAOS! The ocean RUSHES IN, as electricity ARCS up the severed wiring of the sub's MISSLE SYSTEM. It FIRES--!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE POLARIS MISSILES break the water surface, one of wh sports a large GASH in its side, its circuitry sparking; clearly malfunctioning. Their second stage rockets fire, causing several clusters of townsfolk to turn to watch, mouths agape, as the missiles climb up into the night sky

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hogarth and the Giant watch the missiles streak into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: What's happening-- ? Hogarth looks out at the sea. On the decks of one of the warships, he can see people panicking. HOGARTH (CONT’D) There must be some mistake. He looks up at the sky again. A look of fear comes over him. He begins to pace. HOGARTH (CONT’D) Oh no... oh no... In his voice is a note of desperation we've never heard before. The Giant seems to notice. He looks at Hogarth puzzled, trying to understand. Hogarth points at the sky. HOGARTH (CONT’D) The missiles. Missiles! They're nuclear. Nu-cle-ar. When they come down... He mimes a missile coming down and exploding.  88.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Death... The Giant reacts. Hogarth gestures at the town around him HOGARTH (CONT’D) ...everything... The Giant looks at the sky, then at the town, and after a moment, back at Hogarth. He picks up two leaves, one gree and one brown. He gives Hogarth the green leaf, keeping the brown one fo himself. HOGARTH (CONT’D) What? What do you mean? I don't understand! The Giant looks at Hogarth, gently touching the side of h face with a massive finger. And with that, the Giant blas off into the sky. Hogarth looks at his leaf again, anda look of dawning comprehension comes over him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Giant BLASTS ALONG at full power to catch up. His rad tracking, the giant spots the missiles. Suddenly TWO of t missles' rockets fire, sending them off toward separate targets on the earth's surface... ...while the DAMAGED MISSLE just FIZZLES, and slowly star to drop straight down toward Maine far below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie and Dean look out the back window.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Polaris missile, I think.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Shouldn't we get to a shelter?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: It wouldn't matter. They look at each for a long, silent beat. Then he reache out and takes her hand.  89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deathly HUSH has fallen over all assembled. Kent, looki ASHEN, starts slowly backing toward the jeep, and escape. Without turning around, the General barks loudly at Kent.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL
dialogues.text: This is your party, Mansley. Don't even think about leaving early. Lieutenant?? The Lieutenant pulls his sidearm and levels it at Kent. Kent WINCES, caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Giant takes off after the first missile. He concentrates, and the panel on his arm opens up, revealin the now familiar weapon. He FIRES at the distant glare of the missile rockets ... igniting the warhead on the secon shot. There is a blinding FLASH, followed by a shockwave, but the Giant remains intact. He doubles back in pursuit of the second missle. Sighting it, he FIRES --and MISSES repeatedly, losing valuable tim as he moves closer and closer to the missile. Finally he hits it. It EXPLODES too near him, pummeling h throwing him back. The Giant recovers and tries to shoot remaining missile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several jeeps pull up beside Hogarth who is staring at th sky. The General and a group of soldiers jump out. Kent, flanked by soldiers with pistols on him, sits silently in the back of the jeep. The Captain scoops up Hogarth in hi arms and stares at the sky as well.

dialogues.speaker: IN SPACE
dialogues.text: The Giant spots the third missile arcing down toward Main and his beloved Rockwell. He CUTS IN HIS AFTERBURNERS, zooms toward it. The giant catches up to the third missile, but his weapon are CHARRED, unable to fire. There's only one option left...

dialogues.speaker: WITH THE GIANT
dialogues.text: The ROAR of his engines fades into silence as a look of peace falls over his iron face. He wraps his arms around nose of the missile, closing his eyes...  90. ...and slams his fist into the tip of the bomb--

dialogues.speaker: FROM EARTH
dialogues.text: The blackness of the night sky goes brilliant WHITE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lining the streets, the town people see the brilliant whi sky darken, turn back into night... as one, the crowd CHEERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pieces of the giant rain all over the Eastern Hemisphere, a spectacular display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The General gets the word over his headset:

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL
dialogues.text: He did it! The soldiers cheer. The General approaches Kent, still flanked by military officers.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As you for you, Mansley. You're under arrest... "and all that that implies". Kent visably WITHERS.

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH
dialogues.text: But... the giant... The General looks at Hogarth with great sadness... and shakes his head. Hogarth hides his face and SOBS. The CHEERS TRAIL OFF, as the soldiers, realize the great sacrifice that the big metal monster has made for them... and mankind. The General looks at his men.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL
dialogues.text: Let's go home. The General carries Hogarth to the Jeep. Hogarth stares a the GREEN LEAF in his hand. We CLOSE ON on the leaf and..

dialogues.speaker: THE SAME LEAF
dialogues.text: It is now brown. We pull out to reveal that we're in...

dialogues.speaker: HOGARTH'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Where the leaf sits on Hogarth's bookshelf beside the picture of his father. We pan out the window to Rockwell itself. It's springtime. And everything old is new again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean and Annie walk hand in hand with Hogarth alongside. Everyone smiles and waves. All three are now celebrities, and even Dean seems well-liked and respected. The busybodies spot the trio, and whisper to each other.

dialogues.speaker: MYRTLE
dialogues.text: Why, don't they make a lovely family! Dean and Annie exchange a smile. This time Hogarth smiles and nods, too. Then something on the ground catches his e A scorched piece of iron. Hogarth picks it up, examines it, a bittersweet expressio on his face. Hogarth carefully puts the piece in his pocket, and looks up into the sky....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lonely kid from India, SASHI, a tinkerer, sits in his r working on an electronics project. It's a poor but well- kept home. Out a window, a METEOR plows into their field:

dialogues.speaker: THE METEOR CRATER
dialogues.text: Ropes lead down into the crater; PULL BACK TO REVEAL Sash has an elephant pulling out the meteor.

dialogues.speaker: SASHI
dialogues.text: Pull! The elephant strains, pulls: it's the head of the Giant. The boy leaps into the air, shouting, overjoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In an India-version of Hogarth's barn, Sashi cleans the giant head. But it looks dead.  92.

dialogues.speaker: INDIA MOTHER
dialogues.text: Shashi! Dinner!

dialogues.speaker: SHASI
dialogues.text: Coming! Sashi walks out... then CRACKLE! Lights flicker in the Giant's eyes... and the eyes light up. The Giant looks around, comes to his senses, sees his predicament... and the antenna rises up out of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --giant parts, wherever they've fallen, suddenly snap to attention. Several NUTS and BOLTS dig themselves up out of sand. The pieces start hopping away. Part of a FINGER surfaces in the sea and WORMS toward sho A sign by an ocean liner reads "India". Several parts sne up the gangplank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hogarth is awakened by a RATTLING SOUND. He looks to see scorched PIECE OF IRON on his dresser as it drops to the floor and starts moving toward his window. Hogarth BEAMS. ...and opens his window to release it. MUSIC SOARS as the boy watches the piece of metal GO, his mind swimming with new possibilities.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE THE PLANET
dialogues.text: The Giant's scorched HAND orbits listlessly. Suddenly it WAKENS... and slowly turns away from us. Burning as it hi the atmosphere, the hand reaches toward earth... FADE EVERYTHING TO BLACK... except the tiny flaming dot..
